argument.name: %Directives%
argument.description: Refer to Xdialog Language Directives and Operators.
Character. The leading ( and trailing ) characters are required.

argument.name: Variable_Name
argument.description: Character. The name of a character variable to receive the user selection, or a numeric variable to receive the index value of the selected radio button. The index of the top-most button is 1.

page.description: One or more Radio Button objects may appear inside the Format section of a UI_DLG_BOX() function. If you are testing the value of the selected radio button, it is advisable to use ALLTRIM().

section.title: Example
section.description: The following script displays a dialog with three radio buttons: Picture
section.example:
mode = 1 result=ui_dlg_box("Title",<<%dlg% Filename: .32filename; Open as? ; (mode={Shared,Read only,Exclusive});
%dlg%, <<%code% if a_dlg_button = "mode" then if (alltrim(mode) = "Shared") then do something end if end if %code%)

section.description: The next script uses a CR-LF delimited list of choices.
The next script uses an array of choices.
section.example:
dim result as N dim choices3 as C choices1 = "Shared" choices2 = "Read only" choices3 = "Exclusive" mode = 3 result=ui_dlg_box("Title",<<%dlg% Filename: .32filename; Open as? ; (mode=choices);
%dlg% )
